name: In Taste Confounds
description: Opportunists from across time and space are on the hunt. The prize? A Borg queen vessel, chock full of advanced technologies... and also several inert Borg drones. Can you catch this vessel and ensure the drones survive?
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Nona, Fajo, Yates, Borg or matching a Battle Trait will provide a bonus.
-- Using Borg Queen's Vessel, Hirogen Warship, or Miranda Class ship will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Nona, Fajo, Yates or Borg

featured_crew.name: Worf
featured_crew.flavor: Worf teaches Jaxa using a fake advancement test he calls a gik’tail to encourage her to speak up.

featured_crew.name: Kivas
featured_crew.flavor: A collector of rare, strange, and sometimes illegal items, Kivas Fajo faked Data's death in order to add the android into his collection.

featured_crew.name: Yates
featured_crew.flavor: Sympathetic to the Maquis, Kasidy helped Michael Eddington smuggle replicators away from the Cardassians.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Seven
rewards.flavor: After being severed from the Borg Collective, Seven of Nine--now called Seven--struggled to adapt.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Worf
rewards.flavor: Worf teaches Jaxa using a fake advancement test he calls a gik’tail to encourage her to speak up.

rewards.name: Yates
rewards.flavor: Sympathetic to the Maquis, Kasidy helped Michael Eddington smuggle replicators away from the Cardassians.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "Captain. There is a Borg ship, a queencell, I believe it's called--I want it. I want you to help me get it."

"It's been hard to pin down. It keep warping from system to system, maybe searching for the queen... but it's not a toy. It's full of valuable advanced technologies that could help a lot of people. But to stop it, we might need to damage it... and I'm not sure it's unoccupied."
"If anyone is on it, it is Borg--and the Borg are our enemies. Mindless, faceless, killing machines. No one will mourn them. What is theirs should be ours. Then, no one can threaten us ever again."
"Captain. There is a Borg ship, a queencell, I believe it's called--I want it. I want you to help me get it."

"It's been hard to pin down. It keep warping from system to system, maybe searching for the queen... but it's not a toy. It's full of valuable advanced technologies that could help a lot of people. But to stop it, we might need to damage it... and I'm not sure it's unoccupied."
"If anyone is on it, it is Borg--and the Borg are our enemies. Mindless, faceless, killing machines. No one will mourn them. What is theirs should be ours. Then, no one can threaten us ever again."
"I wasn't sure before. Now I'm sure--there are dormant Borg drones on that ship. And if we do what we need to do to capture it, we might be killing them."

responses.text: "Isn't there any way to save the drones first?"
"I have to agree with Fajo. There should be less Borg in the universe, anyway."

screens.text: "You say that as if it should stop me from getting what I want. Why do you people have to complicate things all the time?"
"You've found something I've never wanted and can't imagine ever wanting. Bravo."
"This ship was for the queen. These Borg were chosen to protect her. They should be the worst, the deadliest, the cruelest. More reason to destroy them."

"We could knock out their shields, beam over, finish the process from the inside. We'll be risking our own lives for the drones, but... it's the right thing to do. Everyone can have what they want. Isn't that worth a little more effort?"
"I wasn't sure before. Now I'm sure--there are dormant Borg drones on that ship. And if we do what we need to do to capture it, we might be killing them."

responses.text: "Isn't there any way to save the drones first?"
"I have to agree with Fajo. There should be less Borg in the universe, anyway."

screens.text: "You say that as if it should stop me from getting what I want. Why do you people have to complicate things all the time?"
"You've found something I've never wanted and can't imagine ever wanting. Bravo."
"This ship was for the queen. These Borg were chosen to protect her. They should be the worst, the deadliest, the cruelest. More reason to destroy them."

"We could knock out their shields, beam over, finish the process from the inside. We'll be risking our own lives for the drones, but... it's the right thing to do. Everyone can have what they want. Isn't that worth a little more effort?"
